benchmark_details.name: Plot2Code
benchmark_details.overview: Plot2Code is a comprehensive visual coding benchmark designed for a fair and in-depth assessment of Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) in generating executable code from visual scientific plots. It includes 132 manually selected high-quality matplotlib plots to evaluate MLLMs' code capabilities across various input modalities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective is to evaluate the coding capabilities of multi-modal large language models in generating code from scientific plots.

data.source: 130 matplotlib plots collected from publicly available matplotlib galleries.
data.annotation: Plots are manually curated and paired with their corresponding codes and descriptions generated by GPT-4.

methodology.calculation: The metrics are calculated based on the success of the generated code to recreate the intended plots, comparison of text elements, and overall visual similarity ratings from GPT-4V.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in generating code that produces visually accurate plots.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures include testing the generated code against reference plots and assessing visual similarity through GPT-4V evaluations.
